document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Scheerpeltz, O.
bibRefCitation.refString: Scheerpeltz, O. (1957 a) Staphylinidae (Col.) von Sumba und Flores (4. Beitrag zur Kenntnis der Staphyliniden der orientalischen Region). In: Wissenschaftliche Ergebnisse der Sumba-Expedition des Museum fur Volkerkunde und des Naturhistorischen Museums in Basel, 1949. Verhandlungen der Naturforschenden Gesellschaft in Basel, 68, 217 - 357.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only a single species is included in this genus from South America.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Poederomorphus pedoncularius Gautier des Cottes, 1862

bibRefCitation.author: Bernhauer, M.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bernhauer, M. (1915 a) Neue Staphyliniden der indo-malaiischen Fauna, insbesondere der Sunda-Insel Borneo. (9. Beitrag.) Verhandlungen der Kaiserlich-Koniglichen Zoologisch-Botanischen Gesellschaft in Wien, 65, 134 - 158.

subSubSection.paragraph: 88 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
West Indies: Cuba , Jamaica , Haiti , Martinique , St. Vincent & Grenadines , Trinidad-Tobago.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Belize , Honduras , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , Guyana , French Guiana , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Uruguay , Argentina .
Other regions: Nearctic, Palaearctic, Ethiopian, Madagascan, Oriental , Australian, Oceanic.
